ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:0.4_0: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:0.5_0: 1. The training rule on evenly all around
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:0.6_0: Venerables, these rules to be trained in come up for recitation.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.2_0: the nuns from the group of six wore their sarongs hanging down in front and behind.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.3_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.4_0: “How can nuns wear their sarongs hanging down in front and behind? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.5_0: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.6_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.7_0: “How can the nuns from the group of six wear their sarongs hanging down in front and behind?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.11_0: “... How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.13_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.14.1_0: “‘I will train in the round,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.15_0: One should wear one’s sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.16_0: If a nun, out of disrespect, wears her sarong hanging down in front or behind, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.22_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.24_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:0.2_0: 75. the training rule on defecating in water
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.2_0: the nuns from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting in water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.3_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.4_0: “How can nuns defecate, urinate, and spit in water? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.5_0: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.6_0: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.7_0: “How can the nuns from the group of six defecate, urinate, and spit in water?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.10_0: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.12_0: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.15_0: “... How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.16_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.17_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.18.1_0: ‘“I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.19_0: In this way the Buddha has laid down a training rule for the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.1_0: Soon afterwards, being afraid of wrongdoing, sick nuns did not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.2_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.3_0: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to defecate, urinate, and spit in water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.4_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.5.1_0: ‘“When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.6_0: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.7_0: If, out of disrespect, a nun who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits in water, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.13_0: if she does it on dry ground, but it then spreads to water;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.14_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.17_0: if they are overwhelmed by pain;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.18_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.19_0: The group of fifteen on the fifteenth day, is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.20_0: The seventh sub-chapter on shoes is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.21_0: “Venerables, the rules to be trained in have been recited.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.24_0: A second time I ask the Sangha to answer:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.28_0: This is the meaning of, I will remember it. I will remember it thus.’
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.29_0: The section on the legal procedure is finished.
